Join us on 10/7 for a screening of "Rigged: The Voter Suppression Playbook."
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

For nearly two decades, states across the country have worked to suppress the votes of people of color and younger Americans. Instead of trying to win their votes, powerful politicians have made it harder to vote and to be fairly represented in Congress and state legislatures.

On Monday, October 7, join us for a documentary that identifies and unpacks a shrewd ten-part strategy developed to subvert our sacred democracy. Following the screening, Alex Domingos, an organizer with ACLU-PA's Campaign for Smart Justice, will lead an engaging discussion.

South Central Chapter Film Series

Please join the ACLU of Pennsylvania South Central Chapter for a screening of "Rigged: The Voter Suppression Playbook."

Monday, October 7, 7:30 p.m.
Zoetropolis Cinema Stillhouse
112 North Water Street
Lancaster, PA 17603

Learn More

This is a free event, but seating is limited. Please RSVP by emailing your name and the number of tickets needed to hbginfo@aclupa.org. Closed captioning will be available at the screening, and an ASL interpreter will be on site during the post-film discussion. Guests are encouraged to come early to enjoy dinner or a drink at Zoetropolis's delicious new restaurant! Refreshments can also be purchased at the theater.

Questions? Contact hbginfo@aclupa.org or 717-238-2258.

Save the date! On November 4, we will screen "Reversing Roe."

ACLU of Pennsylvania
